name: operation, housing system, cattle, tied | operation, housing system, cattle, tied, per animal unit | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9645/documentation

This dataset represents the operation of a cattle housing system. The module includes the use of energy and auxiliary materials for the operation of lighting, storage and drying of roughage, slurry agitator, milking machine, milk cooling, cleaning, drinking water. The Functional Unit is 1 livestock unit (LU) during 1 year.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

Operation of the housing system, starting from the various energy carriers and auxiliary materials used.

This activity ends with the service of operation of an agricultural building. The dataset includes the energy and auxiliary materials like water, lubricating oil and cleaning agents. It also takes into account the use of the infrastructure. The dataset doesn't include direct emissions of animal husbandry, fodder production and produced waste water.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/014:Animal production/0141:Raising of cattle and buffaloes

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory applies for Swiss agricultural buildings only, because of the solid method of construction.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Based on selected examples of this type of housing and buildings commonly found in Switzerland in the year 2000;  but not conform to an “average Swiss building style”.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: In the use of energy and auxiliary materials are big differences between the farms. The inventory is based on mean values from CH and WEU.
